p: At a dose of 30â€“100 mg/kg in Wistar rats, the aqueous seed extract of H. pubescens was reported to increase urine output notably. A significant increase of excretion of Na + and K + ions was also observed. The chloroform extract of H. pubescens was also reported to cause a dose-dependent increase in urine output. In addition to this, an elevated level of urinary Na + and K + was also observed, thus showing that increased electrolyte excretion is probably responsible for its diuretic effect [ 127].
